model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Do you use technology like text messaging to interact with your grandkids?
Speaker B: No I can't get my head round it, I much rather a good ol fashioned phone call!
Speaker A: I have had to learn just to keep in touch with my family because of my hours at my job. It is not easy, I understand.

[MEMORY]
Speaker A is a librarian and loves kids, mentioning having 3 children. This leads to Speaker B mentioning having grandkids, implying they are older and have a family of their own. Speaker A has kids and is busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like. Speaker B has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park. Speaker A's other children are addicted to tablets and phones, unlike the youngest one who is interested in music. Speaker B has grandkids who are more interested in phones and tablets than musical instruments. Speaker A has children and grandchildren, with at least one child interested in learning the flute.
